section_id: ## 2. Fractal Set as Adaptive Causal Set

hints.label: def-fractal-set-recap
hints.title: Fractal Set (Episodes + Causal Structure)
hints.content:
71: :label: def-fractal-set-recap
72: 
73: The **Fractal Set** $\mathcal{F} = (E, \prec_{\text{CST}}, \sim_{\text{IG}})$ consists of:
74: 
75: **Elements**: Episodes $E = \{e_1, e_2, \ldots, e_N\}$ generated by Adaptive Gas dynamics, each episode $e_i = (t_i, x_i, v_i, r_i, s_i)$ where:
76: - $t_i \in \mathbb{R}$ is episode time (when it occurred)
77: - $x_i \in \mathcal{X}$ is episode position (where it occurred)
78: - $v_i \in \mathbb{R}^d$ is walker velocity at episode
79: - $r_i \in \mathbb{R}$ is walker reward
80: - $s_i \in \{\text{alive}, \text{dead}\}$ is walker state
81: 
82: **Causal order** $\prec_{\text{CST}}$: CST edges from temporal ordering
hints.section: ## 2. Fractal Set as Adaptive Causal Set
hints.raw_directive:
68: ### 2.1. Fractal Set Definition (Recap)
69: 
70: :::{prf:definition} Fractal Set (Episodes + Causal Structure)
71: :label: def-fractal-set-recap
72: 
73: The **Fractal Set** $\mathcal{F} = (E, \prec_{\text{CST}}, \sim_{\text{IG}})$ consists of:
74: 
75: **Elements**: Episodes $E = \{e_1, e_2, \ldots, e_N\}$ generated by Adaptive Gas dynamics, each episode $e_i = (t_i, x_i, v_i, r_i, s_i)$ where:
76: - $t_i \in \mathbb{R}$ is episode time (when it occurred)
77: - $x_i \in \mathcal{X}$ is episode position (where it occurred)
78: - $v_i \in \mathbb{R}^d$ is walker velocity at episode
79: - $r_i \in \mathbb{R}$ is walker reward
80: - $s_i \in \{\text{alive}, \text{dead}\}$ is walker state
81: 
82: **Causal order** $\prec_{\text{CST}}$: CST edges from temporal ordering
83:

hints.label: thm-fractal-set-riemannian-sampling
hints.title: Fractal Set Episodes Follow Riemannian Volume Measure
hints.content:
92: :label: thm-fractal-set-riemannian-sampling
93: 
94: Episodes generated by the Adaptive Gas are distributed according to:
95: 
96: $$
97: \rho_{\text{episode}}(t, x) = \rho_{\text{temporal}}(t) \cdot \rho_{\text{spatial}}(x)
98: $$
99: 
100: where the **spatial distribution** is (from {prf:ref}`thm-qsd-spatial-marginal-detailed`):
101: 
102: $$
103: \rho_{\text{spatial}}(x) = \frac{1}{Z} \sqrt{\det g(x)} \exp\left(-\frac{U_{\text{eff}}(x)}{T}\right)
104: $$
105: 
106: and $g(x) = H(x) + \epsilon_\Sigma I$ is the emergent Riemannian metric.
107: 
108: **Physical meaning**: Episodes are an **adaptive sprinkling** with density:
109: 
110: $$
111: \rho_{\text{adaptive}}(x) := \sqrt{\det g(x)} \, \psi(x)
112: $$
hints.section: ## 2. Fractal Set as Adaptive Causal Set
hints.raw_directive:
89: ### 2.2. QSD Sampling = Adaptive Sprinkling
90: 
91: :::{prf:theorem} Fractal Set Episodes Follow Riemannian Volume Measure
92: :label: thm-fractal-set-riemannian-sampling
93: 
94: Episodes generated by the Adaptive Gas are distributed according to:
95: 
96: $$
97: \rho_{\text{episode}}(t, x) = \rho_{\text{temporal}}(t) \cdot \rho_{\text{spatial}}(x)
98: $$
99: 
100: where the **spatial distribution** is (from {prf:ref}`thm-qsd-spatial-marginal-detailed`):
101: 
102: $$
103: \rho_{\text{spatial}}(x) = \frac{1}{Z} \sqrt{\det g(x)} \exp\left(-\frac{U_{\text{eff}}(x)}{T}\right)
104: $$
105: 
106: and $g(x) = H(x) + \epsilon_\Sigma I$ is the emergent Riemannian metric.
107: 
108: **Physical meaning**: Episodes are an **adaptive sprinkling** with density:
109: 
110: $$
111: \rho_{\text{adaptive}}(x) := \sqrt{\det g(x)} \, \psi(x)
112: $$
113:

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-50
hints.content:
116: 
117: :::{prf:proof}
118: Direct consequence of Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-qsd-spatial-marginal-detailed` in {doc}`05_qsd_stratonovich_foundations`.
119: 
120: The spatial marginal of the QSD is the stationary distribution of the Stratonovich overdamped Langevin dynamics, which is the Riemannian volume measure weighted by fitness.

119:
